intro: Gomphostylis bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate gomphostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, greenish flowers that are clustered in three-rowed arrays. The botanical characteristics of Gomphostylis bracteata make it well-adapted to moist environments, with its morphology supporting its role in wetland ecosystems.
